column1: Sedation with Ability to Respond to Stimulation or Speech
column9: Received this drug along with versad twice for out-patient varicose vein procedures.  Found it to be effective- meaning I had no pain and wasn't aware of the procedure but could talk with the Dr. alomost immediately after he finished..  Felt and acted a little goofy for the next 24 hours but recovered well.  Only after effects for me were slight nausea and slight headache.

column2: Didi Paano, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had lumbar facet injections past week; doctor used Fentanyl as an anesthetic.  Broke out in severe rash/itching, which has lasted for over a week.  Extremely distressful.  Medication to stop this is also very scary; i.e., Prednisone and Hydroxyzine.   Will NEVER have them use this on me again...not worth the hell I've gone through this past week!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My 13 y/o son was given this following a crushing injury to his foot without effectiveness, after they had given him enough to 'knock a horse down' they gave him demerol with relief.  After orthopedic surgery to fix his foot,(I told the Dr about the first experience with it) he was again given this, without effectiveness. Transferred to Ped unit from Recovery with blood pressure out of this world and in an extreme amount of pain.  They all want me to believe was just a reaction to coming out from under the ansethia.........

column2: pctman, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: my husband was given 175mcg for an endoscopy 1 wk ago and has been forgetting major stuff for the last week like forgetting he already started the car and came back inside to look for his keys and turning the shower on and leaving the bathroom forgetting he had turned it on

column2: vargie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My son was delivered caesarean and I was given Fentanyl for the pain when they sutured me and I was delirious for 3 days the doctors told my husband I could be like this the rest of my life!

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: After being given 400mg of fentanyl, my husband went crazy.  He was calling God to help him for 5 hours.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Great Stuff.  I was given this after open heart surgery after a couple days on morphine and before I was started on dilaudid.  Nurse gave me darvocet first, however, I had an allergic reaction to the darvocet, so they switched to Fentanyl.  I was able to sleep alot which was great.  Easy to use as the nurses just put in by IV.  Much better for pain control than Percocet which I was given at the hospital after a previous heart surgery.

column2: aggrevated, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After being given this medication while in the hospital I have been experiencing severe muscle pain (not associated with my illness) irregular heartbeats, overactive nervous system and trouble seeing.  I would not reccomend this medication to anyone who has trouble with pain medications not working right for them.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Works well in low dosage, too large of a dose will lower your defenses and will make you very lethargic.
